content:
That's amazing! It sounds like you're making great progress with meal planning and grocery shopping. Sticking to your list and avoiding impulse buys is a huge accomplishment, and it's awesome that you're experimenting with new recipes and cooking techniques.

That chicken fajita recipe sounds delicious! Sautéed onions and bell peppers are a great addition to any dish, and I'm sure they added a lot of flavor to your fajitas. What inspired you to try that recipe, and what cooking technique did you use to make the chicken and vegetables?

It's also great to hear that you're having fun with cooking. Cooking can be a really enjoyable hobby, and it's awesome that you're finding joy in it. Keep up the good work, and don't be afraid to try new things and experiment with different ingredients and techniques.

Remember, cooking is all about experimentation and learning, and it's okay to make mistakes. The most important thing is that you're having fun and enjoying the process.

What's next on your cooking agenda? Are there any new recipes or techniques you're looking to try out?
